member.name: P:CarInventory.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: M:CarInventory.CarInventoryForm.btnEnter_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: btnEnter_Click - Will validate that the data entered into the controls is appropriate. - Once the data is validated a car object will be create using the - parameterized constructor. It will also insert the new car object - into the customerList collection. It will also check to see if the data in - the controls has been selected from the listview by the user. In that case - it will need to update the data in the specific customer object and the - listview as well.

member.name: M:CarInventory.CarInventoryForm.ResetTextBoxes
member.summary: Reset - set the controls back to their default state.

member.name: M:CarInventory.CarInventoryForm.IsValidInput
member.summary: IsValidInput - validates the data in each control to ensure that the user has entered apprpriate values

member.name: M:CarInventory.CarInventoryForm.btnReset_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event is declared as private because it is only accessible within the form The code in the btnReset_Click EventHandler will clear the form and set focus back to the input text box.

member.name: M:CarInventory.CarInventoryForm.btnExit_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event is declared as private because it is only accessible within the form The code in the btnExit_Click EventHandler will close the application

member.name: M:CarInventory.CarInventoryForm.lvwCarList_ItemCheck(System.Object,System.Windows.Forms.ItemCheckEventArgs)
member.summary: lvwCarList_ItemCheck - used to prevent the user from checking the check box in the list view - if it is not in edit mode
